Field1: AN 1:21  Ekadhamma Suttas (AN 1:21–30, 39–40) | A Single Thing
Field3: AN 1:21  Ekadhamma Suttas (AN 1:21–30, 39–40) | A Single Thing  —  Short statements on the importance of training one thing: the mind.

Field1: AN 1:45  Udakarahada Suttas (AN 1:45–46) | A Pool of Water
Field3: AN 1:45  Udakarahada Suttas (AN 1:45–46) | A Pool of Water  —  The sullied and unsullied mind compared to a sullied and unsullied pond of water.
AN 1:48  Mudu Sutta | Soft  —  A trained mind is pliant, like balsam.

Field1: AN 1:49  Lahu-parivaṭṭa Sutta | Quick to Reverse Itself
Field3: AN 1:49  Lahu-parivaṭṭa Sutta | Quick to Reverse Itself  —  Even the Buddha, a master of analogies, couldn’t find an analogy for how quick the mind is to reverse itself.
AN 1:50  Pabhassara Suttas (AN 1:50–53) | Luminous  —  Discerning that the mind is luminous but invading by defilements enables you to develop it.

Field1: AN 1:140  Bahujanahitāya Sutta (AN 1:140–141) | For the Benefit of Many People
Field3: AN 1:140  Bahujanahitāya Sutta (AN 1:140–141) | For the Benefit of Many People  —  It’s for the benefit of the world that Dhamma is explained as Dhamma, and not-Dhamma as not-Dhamma.
AN 1:329  Duggandha Sutta | Foul-smelling  —  Becoming compared to feces.
